word:
Huntsville, Alabama 

     Those who have charge of the schoolwork at Graysville [THE PROPERTY AT GRAYSVILLE, TENNESSEE, FIFTY MILES NORTH OF CHATTANOOGA, CONSISTED OF NINE ACRES OF LAND ADJACENT TO A VILLAGE OF ABOUT 200 PEOPLE. THE SCHOOL WAS MOVED TO ITS PRESENT LOCATION AT COLLEGEDALE IN 1916.] and Huntsville should see what can be done by these institutions to establish such industries, so that our people desiring to leave the cities can obtain modest homes without a large outlay of means, and can also find employment.--Letter 25, 1902.
